summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Mortality Review report for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. #76318-054), who died on August 10, 2019. The report details his medical history, the circumstances leading to his death by hanging, the institutional response, and concludes that he received timely and appropriate medical and psychological care.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the mortality review report. A 66-year-old male inmate who died by hanging (asphyxiation) on August 10, 2019, in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: At 2:00 am, Jeffrey Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion on the lower anterior surface of his neck.

events.title: Epstein taken off Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where he was housed with a cellmate.

events.title: Psychology Services evaluation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 am, SHU staff found inmate Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated, EMS was called, and he was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 am by the ER Physician. Cause of death was asphyxiation due to hanging.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York)
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. The official cause of death was asphyxiation secondary to hanging.
Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch on July 23, 2019, for just over 31 hours due to a neck abrasion, but was removed the next day and later placed in the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.
On August 8, 2019, two days before his death, Epstein was evaluated by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.
The Bureau of Prisons Mortality Review Committee concluded that Epstein 'received timely and appropriate medical and psychological care' during his incarceration.
The report lists Epstein's medical history as including Obstructive Sleep Apnea (on CPAP), Hypertriglyceridemia, and L4-L5 Lumbar Stenosis, with no past mental health history prior to incarceration.
